page.title: 19MY DAY IN KINGSCLERE SCHOOL
page.content: On Wednesdays I get up at 7.00 a.m. I dress and go downstairs. I make my lunch for school. At 7.30 I'm ready to eat my breakfast. I get the Frosties down from the shelf and pour them into a dish. After breakfast I read a book. At 8.05 my mum and I get into the car; she drops me off at the top of Ash Grove and drives on to Tadley. I walk down to the gates of Kingsclere Primary School. Not many people are there this early. At last some of my friends come. At 8.55 the whistle goes. We all go on to the playground and one of the teachers tells us to go in. When we get in, our teacher calls the register and we settle down to our maths. The book we use is called Scottish Primary Maths.
